Comments_List: Chamber music helps me to be a better musician and communicator.
I really developed musical skills, as well as interpersonal skills. I also learned how to play viola!
Chamber music is a great class! Got better at playing with a group, and better at my instrument in general.
Develop skills in playing chamber music, working together in a group, commenting on others' performances.
I learned a lot about how to play chamber music at a high level.
This was a great class! It helped better my skills and musical ability working in a chamber music group and introduced me to great works of chamber music I had not heard before.
Playing and listening to chamber music
Knowledge of major chamber music repertoire and good performance practice.

The groups should be better-sorted by ability; allowing groups to choose members is strongly disadvantages freshmen and those new to the course. If you end up with a bad group for the semester, you're not going to have a fun time.

However, coaching was always highly informative and largely eye-opening. Quality of instruction was excellent and masterclasses were good. Perhaps a small restructuring of seminar time would be useful, as I felt it would be good to spend longer with each group (perhaps 2-3 groups every week instead of 4-5 every two weeks?).
Don't have many complaints, it's wonderful!
I really enjoyed both of my coaches. I think it might be good for them to create a more cohesive plan for our coachings - sometimes the things they told us were contradictory.

Course is great. Sometimes it's tough when some group members don't put in as much effort as you might want, but you push through. Sometimes, the coaches focus pretty much solely on their own instrument, which makes it a bit boring for those who don't play the instrument. That goes for comments that are really instrument-specific.
The studio class setup of the course is great, because students can work on performances skills, and use the other students' feedback to improve.
I loved it! Great format of group coachings/studio class, no complaints

The course is very well structured with multiple weekly rehearsals with the chamber group, weekly coaching and biweekly master classes. The ability to work individually with groups and then have frequent performance opportunities makes for a great learning environment.

STRENGTHS: (1) The coaches are fabulous. (2) Studio classes and coachings are helpful and spaced out well. (3) The audition process creates a great peer group. WEAKNESSES: (1) There were too many groups this semester, which resulted in overly long concerts and studio classes. (2) Groups are are almost always assigned works from the standard repertoire. While I do understand the importance of knowing canonical works, I also don't think it's necessary for a musician to know all of the standard repertoire before ever venturing out of it. There's a lot of really incredible literature written after 1950 and/or outside Europe, and I think those works are important for a holistic study of chamber music performance.
Take this course if you'd like to play in a chamber group and learn some awesome chamber repertoire!

Valuable experience as a performer, but be prepared to seriously engage and do your utmost to be placed in a group with whom you know you can work well and who are good players. You'll have a far better time than if you don't. Coachings are always highly informative and very valuable. Don't be fooled by the half credit - this is not an insignificant commitment.
Yes!
Yes!!! I love the chamber music course!
Take it! Who doesn't love chamber music?
It is a fantastic course for all musicians who wish to play chamber music at an intensive level.
Yes, definitely. It's a great class for any classical musician with an interest in chamber music. The quality of the coaching and the other students is excellent.
Playing and getting coached on great chamber music with friends!
Take it. Amazing opportunity to play chamber music and even get credit for it!
I'm so glad I decided to take Chamber! It has been a highlight of my semester, and would definitely recommend!
If you love chamber music, you'd love the class. If you don't know if you love chamber music, but love music, you'd love the class.
This is a great class that helps students develop many skills in playing.
Absolutely! Great way to listen to and play beautiful chamber music with lots of feedback from excellent coaches
I would definitely recommend this course to any musician.
If you are looking for a class to perform chamber music, this is the class to take.
Absolutely! You are guaranteed to learn a lot and get exposed to so much music in this class.

Absolutely! The coaches are great, as is the peer group. This is a serious class, so it's a fulfilling experience but not a trivial time commitment. If you're willing to put in the effort, definitely go for it--you'll learn a lot!
Yes. If you love to play chamber music, this is a great opportunity for you to have the motivation to play
